title: Limit getLastRates() rows fetched to 5K
message:
Limit getLastRates() rows fetched to 5K

Far from a good solution, but does increase loading times with up to 50%.
A better solution would be required. Perhaps a more robust SQL select query.

A 3 days SQLite database may contain up to 20K rows, so fetching and wrapping
all of that into objects takes a lot of time. A Guava Table was used to cache
the results, but the contains() call still takes up to 30% execution time from
the total getLastRates() execution time.

The current, very basic, solution is to limit the rows fetched to 5K. This is
not a good solution and may lead to some rates, those that were not recently
updated, to not being shown in the CurrenciesFragment. Why 5K? There would be
an average of ~50K rows collected in 3 days in the remote database, or about
4,2K per day.

title: SQL optimizations attempt
message:
SQL optimizations attempt

 - Added column index caching
 - Minimized string concats and object creation in getLastRates

Stills seems slow though :confused:

title: Use explicit context passing and assets loading in APISource
message:
Use explicit context passing and assets loading in APISource

The bug was that a static instance of Properties was being used by the service while the
MainActivity context was already destroyed, i.e., OS killed the activity or the user closed it.

This fix makes APISource and AppAssets take a context parameter instead and the assets are being
loaded on demand afterwards.

title: Merge pull request #48 from vexelon-dot-net/bugfix/inconsistent-rates-download
message:
Merge pull request #48 from vexelon-dot-net/bugfix/inconsistent-rates-download

Fix manual and service based currency updates

title: Fix manual and service based currency updates
message:
Fix manual and service based currency updates

The background service will always fetch all currencies for the day. It does that 3-4 times a day.

The manual update will fetch the latest currency date from the database use that as an date time offset for the update.
If the latest currency date is older than the current date, then the beginning of the current day will be used as
an offset date for the update.

Phew!

a source or sort the currencies, the app will crash because the currencyListAdapter is not
yet instantiated.

title: Update service functionality
message:
Update service functionality

Currencies older than 3 days will be cleaned up automatically once the service starts.
The service initial start time changed to 1 minute.
Service will now NOT wake up the device explicitly. It will run every 24h, once the device wakes up.
